title: A closer look: LeGarrette Blount's TD catch | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
At the beginning of the fourth quarter of Sunday night's game with the Colts, the Patriots had the ball at the Indianapolis 11-yard line with a chance to take a two-score lead. Tom Brady scrambled out of pressure and hit LeGarrette Blount for a touchdown, a play that highlighted both Brady's mobility and Blount's spacial awareness to get open on a scramble play. With the score, the Patriots extended their lead to 34-21 early in the fourth quarter before holding on to a 34-27 win.
Here's how the play developed:
Highlighted are Blount and the two middle linebackers that lose track of him bc of Brady scramble+Blount awareness pic.twitter.com/7GvwZbeBsk
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Note receivers, how outside ones cross over to the middle, but especially the safety lining up on Edel/Gronk hash pic.twitter.com/ao9BCczBoB
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Brady looks that way first to draw the safety's eyes there first, but the play looks designed to go to Keshawn Martin.
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 It appears Brady has Martin open here and could have made the throw. The safety is not in position to make a play. pic.twitter.com/8vhpiUEOG4
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Brady, however, feels pressure, and Blount, seeing no blitz from the inside linebackers, sits down as a safety valve.
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Brady's scramble causes one backer to break toward Brady, and Blount alertly sees it. So does the LB behind Blount. pic.twitter.com/8wfrIsYYhE
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 This is where Brady and Blount's chemistry on the fly does wonders. Blount, as noted by others before, worked a lot pic.twitter.com/5ah14aCrCY
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 ... on improving his pass catching ability this offseason. Saw a lot of it in the Carolina preseason game but really all over the place.
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Has become so much more of a complete back. Maybe he was always this way, who knows? We're seeing it come out more now, though.
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 This is the result of Blount's "spacial awareness," moving into a wide open area. The rest is pitch and catch. pic.twitter.com/bs58GYwRoZ
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015 Blount makes the catch and barrels in. Easy call for Edelman. pic.twitter.com/ILq9KGOIiS
— Adam Kurkjian (@AdamKurkjian) October 20, 2015
